messages.subject: Re: abbrev's
messages.msgSnippet: ... get ... I sometimes  unsub for awhile (I did so several times) and of course I miss out on some things.  Otherwise, like having too many newspapers in a
messages.messageBody:
> << i am enjoying the list so far (about a wk) but am wondering about the
> amount
> of mail and if i will feel burdened by it and quit... do you find you
get
> off the list for awhile then come back occasionally? or how do people
> manage
> your email? >>
>

I sometimes unsub for awhile (I did so several times) and of course I miss
out on some things. Otherwise, like having too many newspapers in a pile
because there may be a few gems to read among them, sometimes I have to
just have a big no-regrets "toss-out" to clear my E-mail box and start
fresh.
Mary

messages.subject: Re: abbrev's
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 08/29/1999 6:17:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time, MORELFAM@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 08/29/1999 6:17:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
MORELFAM@... writes:

<< i am enjoying the list so far (about a wk) but am wondering about the
amount
of mail and if i will feel burdened by it and quit... do you find you get
off the list for awhile then come back occasionally? or how do people
manage
your email? >>


I keep getting up earlier to read it .... and, of course, learning to type
faster!!! LOL!!! If you uns*b, and then come back, you can be really lost if
a thread has started while you were gone....also, you miss hearing from
everyone.....it seems like I always come away with a new idea!

Sam

Rachael

messages.subject: Re: abbrev's
messages.msgSnippet: haha! hi sam, this is my first list to join, and i hope i am not too funny about all my typing quirks.  i heard somewhere that no caps (all lowercase) bothers
messages.messageBody:
haha!
hi sam,

this is my first list to join, and i hope i am not too funny about all my
typing quirks. i heard somewhere that no caps (all lowercase) bothers some
people: that and my abbrev's are really just to help me go faster! with a
loop i am finding there is much mail to face! plus, often i have a nursing
squirming toddler half on- half off my lap, so i need all the help i can get!
:)

i am just learning these other "sanctioned" abbreviations (ds,dd, imho,
roflol, etc!)

i am enjoying the list so far (about a wk) but am wondering about the amount
of mail and if i will feel burdened by it and quit... do you find you get
off the list for awhile then come back occasionally? or how do people manage
your email?

thanks for the note, :)
erin
